welcome.name: Welcome
welcome.content:
[![NPM version](https://img.shields.io/npm/v/slash-create?maxAge=3600)](https://www.npmjs.com/package/slash-create) [![NPM downloads](https://img.shields.io/npm/dt/slash-create?maxAge=3600)](https://www.npmjs.com/package/slash-create) [![ESLint status](https://github.com/Snazzah/slash-create/workflows/ESLint/badge.svg)](https://github.com/Snazzah/slash-create/actions?query=workflow%3A%22ESLint%22) [![DeepScan grade](https://deepscan.io/api/teams/11596/projects/15103/branches/297399/badge/grade.svg)](https://deepscan.io/dashboard#view=project&tid=11596&pid=15103&bid=297399) [![discord chat](https://img.shields.io/discord/311027228177727508?logo=discord&logoColor=white)](https://snaz.in/discord) Creator and handler for Discord's [slash commands](https://discord.com/developers/docs/interactions/slash-commands). You can create commands similar to Discord.JS [Commando](https://github.com/discordjs/Commando).
## Features - Multiple server support ([Express](http://expressjs.com/), [Fastify](https://fastify.io/), etc.) - Hook into an existing Discord bot client - Command syncing - Sync commands with your creator automatically. - Load commands from a folder - Command throttling/cooldowns ## Installation ```sh npm i slash-create ``` Or, using yarn: ```sh yarn add slash-create ``` ### Using webservers In order to use a specific webserver, you will need to install the dependency associated with that server. The following server types require these dependencies: - `ExpressServer`: `express` - `FastifyServer`: `fastify` - `GatewayServer`: none, see [example](#/docs/main/latest/examples/discord-bot) - `GCFServer`: none technically, meant for use with [`@google-cloud/functions-framework`](https://npm.im/@google-cloud/functions-framework), see [example](https://slash-create.js.org/#/docs/main/latest/examples/gcf) ## Example ### Creating a SlashCreator ```js const { SlashCreator } = require('slash-create'); const creator = new SlashCreator({ applicationID: '12345678901234567', publicKey: 'CLIENT_PUBLIC_KEY', token: 'BOT_TOKEN_HERE', }); ``` ### Adding commands and syncing them ```js const path = require('path'); creator // Registers all of your commands in the ./commands/ directory .registerCommandsIn(path.join(__dirname, 'commands')) // This will sync commands to Discord, it must be called after commands are loaded. // This also returns itself for more chaining capabilities. .syncCommands(); ``` ### Adding a webserver ```js const { ExpressServer } = require('slash-create'); const path = require('path'); creator .withServer(new ExpressServer()) // Depending on what server is used, this may not be needed. .startServer(); /** * By default, this serves to `127.0.0.1:80/interactions`. * You can change the `serverPort` and `endpointPath` to affect where to serve to. */ /** * You can also initialize the server with an existing application. * If you are doing this with express applications, the express application must already have `express.json()` as middleware. */ creator // Set `alreadyListening` if the server has already started. .withServer(new ExpressServer(app, { alreadyListening: true })); ``` ### Using a Discord Bot with /create ```js const { GatewayServer } = require('slash-create'); const Discord = require('discord.js'); const client = new Discord.Client(); creator .withServer( new GatewayServer( (handler) => client.ws.on('INTERACTION_CREATE', handler) ) ); client.login('BOT_TOKEN_HERE'); ``` ### Example Command ```js const { SlashCommand } = require('slash-create'); module.exports = class HelloCommand extends SlashCommand { constructor(creator) { super(creator, { name: 'hello', description: 'Says hello to you.' }); this.filePath = __filename; } async run(ctx) { return `Hello, ${ctx.user.username}!`; } } ``` ## Useful Links - [**Discord Documentation on Slash Commands**](https://discord.com/developers/docs/interactions/slash-commands) - [Website](https://slash-create.js.org/) ([source](https://github.com/Snazzah/slash-create-website)) - [Documentation](https://slash-create.js.org/#/docs/main/latest/general/welcome) - [Commands Template](https://github.com/Snazzah/slash-create-template) - [GitHub](https://github.com/Snazzah/slash-create) - [NPM](https://www.npmjs.com/package/slash-create)
##### Resources & References This project borrows resources and references from the following repositories: - [dbots.js](https://github.com/dbots-pkg/dbots.js) - [eris](https://github.com/abalabahaha/eris) - [discord.js](https://github.com/discordjs/discord.js) - [Commando](https://github.com/discordjs/Commando) - [slash-worker](https://github.com/A5rocks/slash-worker) - [slash-commands](https://github.com/MeguminSama/discord-slash-commands) - [discord-interactions](https://github.com/discord/discord-interactions-js)

changelog.name: Changelog
changelog.content:
# Changelog
All notable changes to this project will be documented in this file.

The format is based on [Keep a Changelog](https://keepachangelog.com/en/1.0.0/),
and this project adheres to [Semantic Versioning](https://semver.org/spec/v2.0.0.html).

## [Unreleased]
## [2.1.1] - 2021-03-06
### Changed:
- Types for most of the command options reflect on how reliable the `type` property is.
### Fixed:
- Removed checking the `type` property within options to check for subcommand array and options. Not all clients send this type and should not be reliable.
## [2.1.0] - 2021-02-19
### Changed:
- Typings for command options have the `type` prop
- `CommandOption` is deprecated
- `CommandStringOption`, `CommandIntegerOption`, `CommandBooleanOption` are in the index
### Added:
- CommandContexts now support resolved objects
  - `CommandContext#members`, `CommandContext#users`, `CommandContext#roles`, `CommandContext#channels`
  - Note: `ResolvedMember`s in `CommandContext#members` do not have `mute`, `deaf` and `permissions` properties.
### Fixed:
- Updated interaction data typings with the `type` prop
## [2.0.0] - 2021-02-11
### Changed:
- The typings for `DMInteractionRequestData` and `GuildInteractionRequestData` is in the index.
- The typing for `InteractionRequestData` is now a **type** rather than an **interface**.
- The `ping` event now has a `user` parameter.
- **[BREAKING]** `CommandContext#member` and `CommandContext#guildID` is now only given in a guild context.
- **[BREAKING]** `guildID` in command options is now `guildIDs`.
- **[BREAKING]** `SlashCommand#guildID` has been replaced with `SlashCommand#guildIDs`.
### Added:
- Support for updating commands in bulk. This is now used in syncing.
- Support for multiple guild IDs in a command class.
    - `CommandOptions#guildIDs` can either be a string or an array of strings.
- Support for direct message commands.
  - `CommandContext#user` can be used in DM and guild contexts.
### Fixed:
- Unnessesary command updating while syncing.
## [1.3.0] - 2021-01-04
### Changed:
- Permission bitfield now uses bigints
- Command syncing now uses `lodash.isEqual` to check for
- `publicKey` in creator options is now optional
- Typing changes
  - `CommandOption` in constants has split off into `CommandSubcommandOption` and `AnyCommandOption`, not allowing you to define options and a value.
  - Typings for `User`, `Member` and `Message` have been set to read-only
  - Most undocumented typings are hidden/privated
- Export changes
  - Some constant exports now exports to index: `InteractionType`, `InterationResponseType`, `InteractionResponseFlags`, `CommandOptionType`, `PartialApplicationCommand`, `ApplicationCommand`, `ApplicationCommandOption`, `ApplicationCommandOptionChoice`, `RawRequest`, `AnyRequestData`, `PingRequestData`, `InteractionRequestData`, `CommandMember`, `CommandUser`, `CommandData`, `AnyCommandOption`, `CommandOption`, `CommandSubcommandOption`, `ImageFormat`
  - `ConvertedOption` now exports to index
  - `SlashCommandOptions` now exports to index
### Added:
- Commands will automatically acknowledge after 3 seconds to avoid interaction invalidation
  - You can also set `autoAcknowledgeSource` within creator options
- Documentation for unknown commands
- `Member#pending`
### Fixed:
- SlashCreator documentation
- Option validation for unknown commands
- Typings are ignored for `express` and `fastify`
## [1.2.0] - 2020-12-19
### Changed:
- `ctx.options` are a bit more consistent with sub-commands. Check the [last heading in the documetation](#/docs/main/v1.2.0/general/context-options) for an example.
### Added:
- Support for registering/unregistering commands
  - New `SlashCreator` event: `commandUnregister`
  - New `SlashCreator` event: `commandReregister`
  - `SlashCreator.reregisterCommand(command, oldCommand)`
  - `SlashCreator.unregisterCommand(command)`
  - `SlashCommand.reload()`
  - `SlashCommand.unload()`
- Unknown Commands
- [Support for Google Cloud Functions](https://slash-create.js.org/#/docs/main/v1.2.0/examples/gcf). (`GCFServer`)
### Fixed:
- Some documentation
- Command finalization
- Command throttling
- Command options validation
## [1.1.6] - 2020-12-18
### Fixed:
- Sending options as the first argument in `Context#send` & `Context#sendFollowUp`
## [1.1.5] - 2020-12-18
### Fixed:
- Sending options as the first argument in `Context#edit`
## [1.1.4] - 2020-12-17
### Changed:
- Added more validation for options
### Added:
- `CommandContext#subcommands`
### Fixed:
- Option choices validation
## [1.1.3] - 2020-12-17
### Changed:
- Errors in `SlashCreator#startServer` are no longer caught.
- The default port is now `8030`.
- Some documentation clarifying things like tokens.
### Fixed:
- Moved `typed-emitter` to dependencies, fixing typings
## [1.1.2] - 2020-12-17
### Fixed:
- Race conditions for command finalization
- Errors in `SlashCommand#onError` goes to `SlashCreator#error`
## [1.1.1] - 2020-12-17
### Changed:
- `CommandContext#options` is now a non-null object
### Fixed:
- Loading commands in a folder
## [1.1.0] - 2020-12-17
This release features mostly completed documentation and changes to the packages typings. If you are using TypeScript for this package, consider this a **breaking change**.
### Changed:
- **[SEMI-BREAKING]** Index changes
  - `Command` -> `SlashCommand`
  - `Creator` -> `SlashCreator`
  - `CommandContext` is aliased as `Context`
  - `SlashCommand` is aliased as `Command`
  - `SlashCreator` is aliased as `Creator`
  - If you are using any of the changed classes for typings, you must use its class name.
    - i.e. `{ Creator }` must be `{ SlashCreator }`
- (typings) Renamed `AllRequestData` to `AnyRequestData`
- (typings) Renamed `FastifyOpts` to `FastifyOptions`
- (typings) Renamed duplicate `LatencyRef` interface in SequentialBucket to `MinimalLatencyRef`
- (typings) Added CallbackFunction type for SequentialBucket
### Added:
- Fastify typings for `FastifyServer#createEndpoint`
### Fixed:
- Changed HTTP method in `SlashCommandAPI#updateCommand` from `PUT` to `PATCH`
- `User#flags` now actually uses `UserFlags`
- Renamed UserFlags class to the name "UserFlags"
## [1.0.0] - 2020-12-16
### Removed:
- **[BREAKING]** `Context.initialResponseDeleted`
- **[BREAKING]** `treq` parameter from `SlashCreator#ping` event -  The event no longer emits any parameters
### Changed:
- **[BREAKING]** `treq` parameter in `SlashCreator#unknownInteraction` event is now `interaction`
### Added:
- More documentation
- `Context.edit(messageID, content, options)`
- `Context.editOriginal(messageID, content, options)`
- `Context.expired` and internal handlers using this
- `Context.sendFollowUp(content, options)`
- `Message` and `User` class
- `GatewayServer` - Support for gateway events
- `SlashCreatorAPI.interactionCallback(id, token, body)`
- `Server.isWebserver`
- `Server.handleInteraction()`
### Fixed:
- Default error messages
- Exports for Constants and CommandOptionType
## [0.2.0] - 2020-12-16
### Removed:
- **[BREAKING]** `Context.acknowledge` now returns a promise
- **[BREAKING]** Removed `returnPromise` from syncCommands
### Added:
- Errors will be thrown if a Server without its installed package is instantiated
### Fixed:
- RespondFunction is now a promise
- `Context.send` erroring
- Added/Updated debug emit lines
- ExpressServer for TypeScript
## [0.1.0] - 2020-12-15
- Initial release.

context-options.name: CommandContext.options

unknown-command.name: Unknown commands
unknown-command.content:
Unknown commands are commands that fill in for commands that could not be found loaded in the creator. They are not stored normally like regular commands. This can be helpful if a guild has not yet cached the newest version of the global commands or you do not wish to sync commands in order to not lose configuration.

To make a command handled by unknown commands, you can set `unknown` to `true` in the command options.

Important notes about unknown commands:
- The `name`, `description`, `guildID`, `requiredPermissions` and `options` are not considered, since this can be called from any command.
- They do not use the `hasPermission` and the `onBlock` function, however the `onError` function is still used.

props.name: _creator
props.description: The parent creator.

methods.name: createCommand
methods.description: Creates a command.

params.name: guildID
params.description: The guild ID to put the command on. If undefined, the command is global.

methods.name: deleteCommand
methods.description: Deletes a command.

params.name: guildID
params.description: The guild ID to delete the command. If undefined, the global command is deleted.

methods.name: getCommands
methods.description: Gets the commands from an applicaton.

params.name: guildID
params.description: The guild ID to get commands from. If undefined, global commands are fetched.

methods.name: interactionCallback
methods.description: Responds to an interaction.

methods.name: updateCommand
methods.description: Updates a command.

params.name: command
params.description: The payload to update the command to.

params.name: guildID
params.description: The guild ID to put the command on. If undefined, the global command is updated.

methods.name: updateCommands
methods.description: Updates multiple commands.

params.name: commands
params.description: The payload to update the commands to.

params.name: guildID
params.description: The guild ID to put the command on. If undefined, the global command is updated.

props.name: _throttles
props.description: Current throttle objects for the command, mapped by user ID.

props.name: commandName
props.description: The command's name.

props.name: creator
props.description: The creator responsible for this command.

props.name: description
props.description: The command's description.

props.name: filePath
props.description:
The file path of the command.
Used for refreshing the require cache.
Set this to `__filename` in the constructor to enable cache clearing.

props.name: guildIDs
props.description: The guild ID(s) for the command.

props.name: options
props.description: The options for the command.

props.name: requiredPermissions
props.description: The permissions required to use this command.

props.name: throttling
props.description: The throttling options for this command.

props.name: unknown
props.description: Whether this command is used for unknown commands.

props.name: commandJSON
props.description: The JSON for using commands in Discord's API.

props.name: keyName
props.description: The internal key name for the command.

methods.name: finalize
methods.description: Finalizes the return output

methods.name: hasPermission
methods.description: Checks whether the context member has permission to use the command.
methods.returnsDescription: Whether the member has permission, or an error message to respond with if they don't

methods.name: onBlock
methods.description: Called when the command is prevented from running.

params.name: ctx
params.description: Command context the command is running from

params.name: reason
params.description:
Reason that the command was blocked
(built-in reasons are `permission`, `throttling`)

params.name: data
params.description:
Additional data associated with the block.
- permission: `response` ({@link string}) to send
- throttling: `throttle` ({@link Object}), `remaining` ({@link number}) time in seconds

methods.name: onError
methods.description: Called when the command produces an error while running.

params.name: ctx
params.description: Command context the command is running from

methods.name: reload
methods.description: Reloads the command.

methods.name: run
methods.description: Runs the command.

methods.name: throttle
methods.description: Creates/obtains the throttle object for a user, if necessary.

params.name: userID
params.description: ID of the user to throttle for

methods.name: unload
methods.description: Unloads the command.

methods.name: validateOptions
methods.description: Validates {@link SlashCommandOptions}.

params.name: data
params.description: The interaction data for the context.

params.name: respond
params.description: The response function for the interaction.

params.name: webserverMode
params.description: Whether the interaction was from a webserver.

props.name: _respond
props.description: The initial response function.

props.name: _timeout
props.description: The timeout for the auto-response.

props.name: channelID
props.description: The channel ID that the command was invoked in.

props.name: channels
props.description: The resolved channels of the interaction.

props.name: commandID
props.description: The command's ID.

props.name: commandName
props.description: The command's name.

props.name: creator
props.description: The creator of the command.

props.name: data
props.description: The full interaction data.

props.name: guildID
props.description: The guild ID that the command was invoked in.

props.name: initiallyResponded
props.description: Whether the initial response was made.

props.name: interactionID
props.description: The interaction's ID.

props.name: interactionToken
props.description: The interaction's token.

props.name: invokedAt
props.description: The time when the context was created.

props.name: member
props.description: The member that invoked the command.

props.name: members
props.description: The resolved members of the interaction.

props.name: options
props.description: The options given to the command.

props.name: roles
props.description: The resolved roles of the interaction.

props.name: subcommands
props.description: The subcommands the member used in order.

props.name: user
props.description: The user that invoked the command.

props.name: users
props.description: The resolved users of the interaction.

props.name: webserverMode
props.description: Whether the context is from a webserver.

props.name: expired
props.description: Whether the interaction has expired. Interactions last 15 minutes.

methods.name: acknowledge
methods.description: Acknowleges the interaction. Including source will send a message showing only the source.

params.name: includeSource
params.description: Whether to include the source in the acknowledgement.

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Deletes a message. If the message ID was not defined, the original message is used.

methods.name: edit
methods.description: Edits a message.

methods.name: editOriginal
methods.description:
Edits the original message.
This is put on a timeout of 150 ms for webservers to account for
Discord recieving and processing the original response.
Note: This will error with ephemeral messages or acknowledgements.

methods.name: send
methods.description:
Sends a message, if it already made an initial response, this will create a follow-up message.
This will return a boolean if it's an initial response, otherwise a {@link Message} will be returned.
Note that when making a follow-up message, the `ephemeral` and `includeSource` are ignored.

methods.name: sendFollowUp
methods.description: Sends a follow-up message.

classes.name: SlashCreator
classes.description: The main class for using commands and interactions.

props.name: allowedMentions
props.description: The formatted allowed mentions from the options

props.name: api
props.description: The API handler for the creator

props.name: commands
props.description: The commands loaded onto the creator

props.name: commandsPath
props.description: The path where the commands were loaded from

props.name: options
props.description: The options from constructing the creator

props.name: requestHandler
props.description: The request handler for the creator

props.name: server
props.description: The server being used in the creator

props.name: unknownCommand
props.description: The command to run when an unknown command is used.

methods.name: registerCommand
methods.description: Registers a single command

params.name: command
params.description: Either a Command instance, or a constructor for one

methods.name: registerCommands
methods.description: Registers multiple commands

params.name: commands
params.description: An array of Command instances or constructors

params.name: ignoreInvalid
params.description: Whether to skip over invalid objects without throwing an error

methods.name: registerCommandsIn
methods.description: Registers all commands in a directory. The files must export a Command class constructor or instance.

params.name: options
params.description: The path to the directory, or a require-all options object

methods.name: reregisterCommand
methods.description: Reregisters a command. (does not support changing name, or guild IDs)

methods.name: startServer
methods.description: Starts the server, if one was defined.

methods.name: syncCommands
methods.description:
Sync all commands with Discord. This ensures that commands exist when handling them.
<warn>This requires you to have your token set in the creator config.</warn>

methods.name: syncCommandsIn
methods.description:
Sync guild commands.
<warn>This requires you to have your token set in the creator config.</warn>

params.name: deleteCommands
params.description: Whether to delete command not found in the creator

methods.name: syncGlobalCommands
methods.description:
Sync global commands.
<warn>This requires you to have your token set in the creator config.</warn>

params.name: deleteCommands
params.description: Whether to delete command not found in the creator

methods.name: unregisterCommand
methods.description: Unregisters a command.

methods.name: withServer
methods.description: Attaches a server to the creator.

events.name: commandBlock
events.description: Emitted when a command is blocked.

params.name: reason
params.description: Reason that the command was blocked

params.name: data
params.description: Additional data associated with the block.

events.name: commandError
events.description: Emitted when a command gave an error.

events.name: commandRegister
events.description: Emitted when a command is registered.

params.name: creator
params.description: Creator that the command was registered to

events.name: commandReregister
events.description: Emitted when a command is reregistered

events.name: commandRun
events.description: Emitted when a command is ran.

events.name: commandUnregister
events.description: Emitted when a command is unregistered

events.name: debug
events.description: Emitted when a debug message is given.

events.name: ping
events.description: Emitted when Discord pings the interaction endpoint.

params.name: user
params.description: The user that requested the ping

events.name: rawREST
events.description: Emitted when the Client's RequestHandler receives a response.

events.name: synced
events.description: Emitted when the creator successfully synced commands.

events.name: unknownInteraction
events.description: Emitted when an unknown interaction type is encountered.

events.name: unverifiedRequest
events.description: Emitted when a request failed to be verified.

events.name: warn
events.description: Emitted when a warning is given.

props.name: res

props.name: stack

params.name: res
params.description: An incoming message from the server

props.name: code
props.description: The error code from the response.

props.name: message
props.description: The message of the error.

props.name: req
props.description: The client request of the error.

props.name: res
props.description: The response from the server.

props.name: response
props.description: The response class from a {@link Server}.

props.name: stack
props.description: The error stack.

params.name: isWebserver
params.description: Whether this server is a webserver

props.name: alreadyListening
props.description: Whether this server is already listening to a port.

props.name: isWebserver
props.description: Whether this server is a webserver.

params.name: app
params.description: The express application. Must have express.json installed as a middleware.

props.name: alreadyListening
props.description: Whether this server is already listening to a port.

props.name: isWebserver
props.description: Whether this server is a webserver.

methods.name: addMiddleware
methods.description: Adds middleware to the Express server.

methods.name: set
methods.description: Sets an Express setting.

params.name: value
params.description: The value to set the setting to

methods.name: use
methods.description: Alias for {@link ExpressServer#addMiddleware}

params.name: app
params.description: The fastify application, or the options for initialization

props.name: alreadyListening
props.description: Whether this server is already listening to a port.

props.name: isWebserver
props.description: Whether this server is a webserver.

methods.name: addMiddleware
methods.description:
Adds middleware to the Fastify server.
<warn>This requires you to have the 'middie' module registered to the server before using.</warn>

methods.name: use
methods.description: Alias for {@link FastifyServer#addMiddleware}

classes.name: GatewayServer
classes.description: A "server" for gateway connections to pipe events into.

params.name: eventHandler
params.description: A function that is used to handle the event for gateway interactions.

props.name: alreadyListening
props.description: Whether this server is already listening to a port.

props.name: isWebserver
props.description: Whether this server is a webserver.

params.description: The exports for your module, must be `module.exports`

params.description: The name of the exported function

classes.name: Permissions
classes.description:
Data structure that makes it easy to interact with a permission bitfield.
All {@link Member}s have a set of permissions.

props.name: bitfield
props.description: Bitfield of the packed bits.

props.name: FLAGS
props.description: Permission flags. Check the source of this property for available permissions.

methods.name: any
methods.description: Checks whether the bitfield has a bit, or any of multiple bits.

methods.name: equals
methods.description: Checks if this bitfield equals another.

methods.name: has
methods.description: Checks whether the bitfield has a bit, or multiple bits.

methods.name: missing
methods.description: Gets all given bits that are missing from the bitfield.

methods.name: serialize
methods.description:
Gets an object mapping field names to a {@link boolean} indicating whether the
bit is available.

methods.name: toArray
methods.description: Gets an {@link Array} of bitfield names based on the bits available.

methods.name: resolve
methods.description: Resolves bitfields to their numeric form.

params.name: userData
params.description: The data for the member's user

props.description: The creator of the member class.

props.name: pending
props.description: Whether the member is pending verification

props.name: premiumSince
props.description: The time of when this member boosted the server.

props.description: An array of role IDs that the user has.

props.description: The display name for this member.

props.description: The string that mentions this member.

props.description: The role's color integer

props.description: The role's ID

props.description: Whether the role is mentionable by everyone

props.description: The role's name

props.name: position
props.description: The role's position

props.name: colorHex
props.description: The role's color in hexadecimal, with a leading hashtag

props.name: mention
props.description: The string that mentions this role.

props.name: permissions
props.description: The permissions the member has.

props.name: _creator
props.description: The creator of the user class.

props.name: avatar
props.description: The user's avatar hash.

props.name: bot
props.description: Whether the user is a bot.

props.name: discriminator
props.description: The user's discriminator.

props.description: The user's ID.

props.name: username
props.description: The user's username.

props.name: avatarURL
props.description: The URL of the user's avatar.

props.name: defaultAvatar
props.description: The hash for the default avatar of a user if there is no avatar set.

props.name: defaultAvatarURL
props.description: The URL of the user's default avatar.

props.name: flags
props.description: The public flags for the user.

props.description: A string that mentions the user.

methods.description: Get the user's avatar with the given format and size.

classes.name: UserFlags

props.name: bitfield
props.description: Bitfield of the packed bits.

props.name: FLAGS
props.description: The flags for users. Check the source of this property for available flags.

methods.name: any
methods.description: Checks whether the bitfield has a bit, or any of multiple bits.

methods.name: equals
methods.description: Checks if this bitfield equals another.

methods.name: has
methods.description: Checks whether the bitfield has a bit, or multiple bits.

methods.name: missing
methods.description: Gets all given bits that are missing from the bitfield.

methods.name: serialize
methods.description:
Gets an object mapping field names to a {@link boolean} indicating whether the
bit is available.

methods.name: toArray
methods.description: Gets an {@link Array} of bitfield names based on the bits available.

methods.name: resolve
methods.description: Resolves bitfields to their numeric form.

classes.name: BitField
classes.description: Data structure that makes it easy to interact with a bitfield.

props.name: bitfield
props.description: Bitfield of the packed bits.

props.name: FLAGS
props.description: The flags for this bitfield.

methods.name: any
methods.description: Checks whether the bitfield has a bit, or any of multiple bits.

methods.name: equals
methods.description: Checks if this bitfield equals another.

methods.name: has
methods.description: Checks whether the bitfield has a bit, or multiple bits.

methods.name: missing
methods.description: Gets all given bits that are missing from the bitfield.

methods.name: serialize
methods.description:
Gets an object mapping field names to a {@link boolean} indicating whether the
bit is available.

methods.name: toArray
methods.description: Gets an {@link Array} of bitfield names based on the bits available.

methods.name: resolve
methods.description: Resolves bitfields to their numeric form.

classes.name: RequestHandler
classes.description: The request handler for REST requests.

props.name: _creator
props.description: The creator that initialized the handler.

props.name: agent
props.description: TheHTTP agent used in the request handler.

props.name: baseURL
props.description: The base URL for all requests.

props.name: globalBlock
props.description: Whether the handler is globally blocked.

props.name: latencyRef
props.description: The latency reference for the handler.

props.name: ratelimits
props.description: The ratelimits per route.

props.name: readyQueue
props.description: The request queue.

props.name: requestTimeout
props.description: The amount of time a request will timeout.

props.name: userAgent
props.description: The user agent for all requests.

methods.name: globalUnblock
methods.description: Unblocks the request handler.

methods.name: request
methods.description: Make an API request

params.name: auth
params.description: Whether to add the Authorization header and token or not

classes.name: SequentialBucket
classes.description: Ratelimit requests and release in sequence.

params.name: limit
params.description: The max number of tokens the bucket can consume per interval

props.name: limit
props.description: How many tokens the bucket can consume in the current interval.

props.name: processing
props.description: Whether the queue is being processed.

props.name: remaining
props.description: How many tokens the bucket has left in the current interval.

props.name: reset
props.description: Timestamp of next reset.

methods.name: check
methods.description: Checks the bucket and runs through the functions.

params.name: override
params.description: Whether to override the processing property

methods.name: queue
methods.description: Queue something in the SequentialBucket

params.name: func
params.description: A function to call when a token can be consumed. The function will be passed a callback argument, which must be called to allow the bucket to continue to work

props.name: description
props.description: The description of the command.

props.name: guildIDs
props.description: The guild ID(s) that this command will be assigned to.

props.name: name
props.description: The name of the command.

props.name: options
props.description: The command's options.

props.name: requiredPermissions
props.description: The required permission(s) for this command.

props.name: throttling
props.description: The throttling options for the command.

props.name: unknown
props.description: Whether this command is used for unknown commands.

typedefs.name: ThrottlingOptions
typedefs.description: The throttling options for a {@link SlashCommand}.

props.name: duration
props.description: Amount of time to count the usages of the command within (in seconds).

props.name: usages
props.description: Maximum number of usages of the command allowed in the time frame.

typedefs.name: CommandOptionType
typedefs.description: An object mapping the types a command option can use.

props.name: BOOLEAN
props.description: A boolean.

props.name: CHANNEL
props.description: A channel, this would return the channel's ID in the interaction.

props.name: INTEGER
props.description: An integer.

props.name: ROLE
props.description: A role, this would return the role's ID in the interaction.

props.name: STRING
props.description: A string.

props.name: SUB_COMMAND
props.description: A sub-command for the application's command

props.name: SUB_COMMAND_GROUP
props.description: A group of sub-commands

props.name: USER
props.description: A user, this would return the user's ID in the interaction.

props.name: EPHEMERAL
props.description: Sends a message back to the invoker, similar to messages by Clyde.

props.name: COMMAND
props.description: A command invocation.

props.name: PING
props.description: A ping.

props.name: ACKNOWLEDGE
props.description: Acknowledge a command without sending a message.

props.name: ACKNOWLEDGE_WITH_SOURCE
props.description: Acknowledge a command without sending a message, showing the user's input.

props.name: CHANNEL_MESSAGE
props.description: Respond with a message.

props.name: CHANNEL_MESSAGE_WITH_SOURCE
props.description: Respond with a message, showing the user's input.

props.name: PONG
props.description: Acknowledge a `PING`.

props.name: application_id
props.description: The application's ID responsible for this command.

props.name: description
props.description: The description of the command.

props.name: guild_id
props.description: The guild ID this comamnd is exlusive to.

props.name: id
props.description: The command's ID.

props.name: name
props.description: The name of the command.

props.name: options
props.description: The optoins for the command.

props.name: version
props.description: The version ID of the command.

typedefs.name: ApplicationCommandOption
typedefs.description: An option in an application command.

props.name: choices
props.description: The choices of the option. If set, these are the only values a user can pick from.

props.name: default
props.description: The first required option the user has to complete.

props.name: description
props.description: The description of the option.

props.name: name
props.description: The name of the option.

props.name: options
props.description: The sub-options for the option. This can only be used for sub-commands and sub-command groups.

props.name: required
props.description: Whether the command is required.

props.name: type
props.description: The type of option this one is.

typedefs.name: ApplicationCommandOptionChoice
typedefs.description: A choice for a user to pick from.

props.name: name
props.description: The name of the choice.

props.name: value
props.description: The value of the choice.

props.name: name
props.description: The name for the option.

props.description: The name for the option.

props.name: content
props.description: The message content.

props.name: embeds
props.description: The embeds of the message.

props.name: ephemeral
props.description:
Whether or not the message should be ephemeral.
Ignored if `flags` is defined.

props.name: flags
props.description: The flags to use in the message.

props.name: includeSource

typedefs.name: ConvertedOption
typedefs.description: Command options converted for ease of use.

typedefs.name: SlashCreatorEvents
typedefs.description: The events typings for the {@link SlashCreator}.

props.name: agent
props.description: A HTTP Agent used to proxy requests

props.name: allowedMentions
props.description: The default allowed mentions for all messages.

props.name: applicationID
props.description: Your Application's ID

props.name: autoAcknowledgeSource
props.description: Whether to include source in the auto-acknowledgement timeout.

props.name: defaultImageFormat
props.description: The default format to provide user avatars in.

props.name: defaultImageSize
props.description: The default image size to provide user avatars in.

props.name: endpointPath
props.description: The path where the server will listen for interactions.

props.name: latencyThreshold
props.description: The average latency where SlashCreate will start emitting warnings for.

props.name: maxSignatureTimestamp
props.description: A number of milliseconds before requests with a timestamp past that time get rejected.

props.name: publicKey
props.description:
The public key for your application.
Required for webservers.

props.name: ratelimiterOffset
props.description: A number of milliseconds to offset the ratelimit timing calculations by.

props.name: requestTimeout
props.description: A number of milliseconds before requests are considered timed out.

props.name: serverHost
props.description: The host where the server will listen on.

props.name: serverPort
props.description: The port where the server will listen on.

props.name: token
props.description:
The bot/client token for the application.
Recommended to set this in your config.

props.name: unknownCommandResponse
props.description:
Whether to respond to an unknown command with an ephemeral message.
If an unknown command is registered, this is ignored.

props.name: deleteCommands
props.description: Whether to delete commands that do not exist in the creator.

props.name: skipGuildErrors
props.description:
Whether to skip over guild syncing errors.
Guild syncs most likely can error if that guild no longer exists.

props.name: syncGuilds
props.description: Whether to sync guild-specific commands.

props.name: body
props.description: The body of the response.

props.name: headers
props.description: The headers for the response.

props.name: status
props.description: The status code for the response.

props.name: alreadyListening
props.description: Whether or not the server is already listening to a port.

props.name: body
props.description: The body of the request.

props.name: headers
props.description: The headers of the request.

props.name: request
props.description: The request class from a Server, depending on what server it is.

props.name: response
props.description: The response class from a Server, depending on what server it is.

typedefs.name: MessageAllowedMentions
typedefs.description: The allowed mentions for a {@link Message}.
